content: If 1 in 20 people click on their links the way you do, I say the Medium editors are meeting, if not exceeding, their company’s expectations. They don’t need to be great because they play a different game than mainstream publications. Medium wants users to spend more time in the platform, even if that means it takes more clicks for you to find what you like; while the major newspapers actually try to drive traffic to their sites through headlines. What’s sad is I still read more Medium staff picks than NY Times or Washington Post articles — that’s how lousy these publications have gotten.
